intro: Lacistema blanchetii, commonly known as the Mexican nightshade, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and peppers. The plant is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit, with hairy stems and alternate leaves. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that bloom at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators. The fruit is a spherical berry that turns red when mature, containing several seeds.
